page.title: 02HOUSING IN PERTH
page.content: Housing in Perth reflects both the city's historical background and recent developments. There has been a gradual expansion westwards from the medieval core of the town. This development has been added to by subsequent 20th century expansion. The prime existing example of {medieval architecture}is the 15th century St.John's Kirk in the town centre. The only other significant remnant of such heritage is the gridiron street pattern of closes and vennels in the centre of town. {Georgian housing}occurs beyond the boundaries of the long demolished city walls. Some houses are large and impressive residences, often occupied by surgeries and offices. The elegant Rose Terrace is currently being renovated and its facade preserved. **************************************
